Fitting¶

Fitting is performed using the MultiModeFCFitting class:

class franckcondon.MultiModeFCFitting[source]¶

Class for fitting Franck-Condon progressions to experimental data.

Refer to the examples for more detailed guidelines.

spectrum_type¶

either ‘pl’ (photoluminescence) or ‘abs’ (absorption)

Type

str

num_modes¶

the number of vibrational modes to be included

Type

int

num_replicas¶

the number of vibronic replicas to be calculated

Type

int

refractive_index¶

refractive index of the surroundings (arbitrary in practice)

Type

int

fit_vibrational_energies¶

how many vibrational energies to fit. Either ‘all’, ‘None’ or a list of indicies

Type

str or list of int

fit_hr_params¶

how many Huang-Rhys parameters to fit. Either ‘all’, ‘None’ or a list of indicies

Type

str or list of int

fit_broadening¶

whether to fit the linewidth

Type

book

fit_energy_00¶

whether to fit the energy of the 0-0 transition

Type

bool

fit_scaling_factor¶

whether to fit the scaling factor (highly recommended)

Type

bool

algorithm¶

least_squares algorithm to use (see scipy.optimize.least_squares)

Type

str

enforce_non_negativity¶

whether to force all fitted parameters to have positive values (recommended)

Type

bool

See also

franckcondon.MultiModeFC

calculating progressions

Examples

>>> import pandas as pd
>>> data = pd.read_csv('example_data.csv', header=None, index_col=0, squeeze=True)
>>> x = data.index.values
>>> y = data.values
>>> hr_params = [1, 0.5]
>>> vib_energies = [0.19, 0.067]
>>> energy_00 = 3.77
>>> broadening = 0.027
>>> mmfcf = MultiModeFCFitting()
>>> mmfcf.spectrum_type = 'pl'
>>> scaling_factor = 150
>>> mmfcf.input_data(x, y)
>>> mmfcf.correct_for_phonon_dos()
>>> mmfcf.input_parameters(vib_energies, hr_params, energy_00, broadening, scaling_factor)
>>> mmfcf.initialise(2)  # there are two modes
>>> mmfcf.check_initial_guess()
>>> mmfcf.fit_broadening = True
>>> mmfcf.fit_hr_params = 'all'
>>> mmfcf.fit_vibrational_energies = 'all'
>>> mmfcf.perform_fit()
>>> mmfcf.print_result(tofile=False)
>>> mmfcf.plot_result(save=False)
>>> mmfcf.save()
calculate_fc_progression(x, vib_energies, hr_params, energy_00, broadening)¶

Calculate the multi-mode Franck-Condon progression.

Parameters

  • x (numpy.ndarray) – 1D array containing the energy values to use in the calculation.

  • vib_energies (list of float) – The vibrational energies of the modes.

  • hr_params (list of float) – The Huang-Rhys parameters of the modes.

  • energy_00 (float) – The energy of the 0-0 transition.

  • broadening (float) – The linewidth broadening.

Returns

model – 1D array containing the calculated Franck-Condon progression.

Return type

numpy.ndarray

calculate_reorganisation_energy()[source]¶

Compute the reorganisation energy based on the fitted parameters.

Returns

Return type

None.

check_initial_guess()[source]¶

Create a plot showing the data and model.

Useful for checking how good the initial parameter guess is.

Returns

Return type

None.

correct_for_phonon_dos()[source]¶

Correct the experimental data for the phonon density of states.

Returns

Return type

None.

initialise(num_modes)¶

Set the number of vibrational modes and calculate the permutations of vibrational quanta.

Parameters

num_modes (int) – the number of vibrational modes to be included

Returns

Return type

None.

input_data(x, y)[source]¶

Load the experimental data.

Parameters

  • x (numpy.ndarray) – 1D array containing the energy values.

  • y (numpy.ndarray) – 1D array containing the spectrum values.

Returns

Return type

None.

input_parameters(vib_energies, hr_params, energy_00, broadening, scaling_factor)[source]¶

Load the Franck-Condon parameters.

They are either fixed or used as starting points for the fitting.

Parameters

  • vib_energies (list of float) – The vibrational energies of the modes.

  • hr_params (list of float) – The Huang-Rhys parameters of the modes.

  • energy_00 (float) – The energy of the 0-0 transition.

  • broadening (float) – The linewidth broadening.

  • scaling_factor (float) – A factor to scale the data in order to match the fit (which is normalised to approximately 1)

Returns

Return type

None.

perform_fit()[source]¶

Do the fitting.

Returns

Return type

None.

plot_modes(x, model, vib_energies, hr_params, energy_00, broadening)¶

Create a plot showing the total Franck-Condon progression and mode-resolved 0-0 and 0-1 peaks.

Parameters

  • x (numpy.ndarray) – 1D array containing the energy values to use in the calculation.

  • model (numpy.ndarray) – 1D array containing the calculated model from MultiModeFC.calculate_fc_progression

  • vib_energies (list of float) – The vibrational energies of the modes.

  • hr_params (list of float) – The Huang-Rhys parameters of the modes.

  • energy_00 (float) – The energy of the 0-0 transition.

  • broadening (float) – The linewidth broadening.

Returns

  • fig (matplotlib.figure.Figure) – A figure handle for the generated plot.

  • ax (matplotlib.axes.Axes) – An axes object for the generated plot.

plot_result(save=True)[source]¶

Create a plot of the data and the fitted model.

Parameters

save (bool, optional) – Whether to save the plot. If True, it will be saved to fc_fit.png. The default is True.

Returns

Return type

None.

print_result(tofile=False)[source]¶

Print the parameter values to console or file.

Parameters

tofile (bool, optional) – If True the values are printed to file. If False they are printed to console. The default is False.

Returns

Return type

None.

save()[source]¶

Save the fitted model.

The total progression as well as the 0-0 and 0-1 contributions will be saved to fc_fit.csv.

Returns

Return type

None.
